text: Vom Faß im Nürnberger Altstadthof. - Mittleres Goldbraun, leicht trüb, schöne Schaumringe im Glas. - In der Nase breit hellmalzig-karamellig mit zarten Gewürzen (Anis?) und mild krautigem Hopfen. - Antrunk bocktypisch breit hellmalzig-süß mit leichter Gewürznote und komplexer hopfenwürziger Herbe: Sahnebonbons, Kräuter. Mild rezent, sehr vollmundig, sämig. Zum Ende hin beträchtliche krautig-aromatische Hopfenherbe. Gut bitterer Abgang. - Gediegen malzaromatischer heller Bock mit großzügiger, aromatischer Hopfung. Ausgezeichnet!

Tab at the Brewpub - Goldene Farbe mit stabiler Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr blumig, lecker. Im Antrunk dann etwas weniger fruchtig, aber nicht schlecht. Körper voll und kantig, leicht mineralisch. Aromen von Malz, Heu und etwas Honig. Trockener Abgang.
Draft @the brewpub. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak caramel aroma. Sweetish malty caramel grainy flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy grainy caramel finish.
Tap at Fränkisches bierfest. Cloudy orange red, eggshell head. Light fruity notes, apples, medium body, mellow mouthfeel. Medium light body, not too sweet, meaty finish.

On tap the brewery in Nurnberg. Hazy amber colour lasting cream head. wow certainly a lot of hops. too sweet. the hop aroma is crazy noble hop. not too bitter. its a very drinkable bock. Hides abv well. Tasty. you have to love those hops. gets sweeter on the finish.

Amazing. Perfect appetizing aroma. Lots of head full of pear and grape sweetness. Crispy, tart, with some bitter hops and later on full malty balance. So complex it is really all over the place. Light body that doesnt stick around on the palate for long sadly. Something special. thanks Lagzibacsi!
On tap the Schwarzer Bauer, Nurnberg, 4/5/2014. Hazy gold with a decent white head. Solid, slightly earthy mlats, some sweetish stone fruits, leafy hops and a lingering, bitter finish. Very good.

Draught @ Nürnberger Altstadthof, Bergstrasse 19, Nuremberg, Bavaria Germany 90403.Unclear medium orange colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, fruity malt, sweet malt. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet with a long duration, malt - grain, sweet malt, fruity, sugary malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130511]

On tap. Clear light orange body, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, orange zest, honey and grassy hops. Taste follows the aroma. Grassy hops, orange, honey, toast and caramel. Medium bodied, easy to drink. Awesome beer.

Had this on tap at Schwarzer Bauer, Hausbrauerei, Nuremberg, Germany, Tuesday 5th June 2012  Pours reddy/amber with white head. Really tasty beer that impresses with a nice burnt toffee and good bittersweetness, quite full flavoured, very soft in the mouth with a blanket of gentle bubbles. I like the thick mouthfeel, this also has a fruity backbite.  A7 A5 T8 P4 Ov15 3.9

Aroma is grassyness, some bready malts, mild alcohol as well as quite herbal notes. Flavour is quite strong on the malty side with mild notes of alcohol as well as some mild honeyish notes. Sweet malty finish.
Had this in route to Bamberg from Munich. They had no weizen so I read this one was the best here. I fantastic beer. One of my favorites for sure.

(draught, at the Altstadthof brewpub) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of herbal hops, honey, lavender and a touch of grain. flavour is fruity, grassy hops over a backdrop of honeyed grain and light wood. medium body with smooth carbonation and a light bitter finish.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2009 A great Heller Bock. Very fresh and crisp flavor with a nice finish. Great with the sausages. In my mind one of the best beers in Germany. Watch out they will sneak up on you since they go down so easy. Only availible in the springtime.

Very flowerly aroma, fruity and fresh. Dense white head, hazy yello color. Flavor is malty, sweet and fruity with light flowerly notes. Notes of honey, hoppy. Hop bitter finish. Very good, flowerly bock.

i loved altstadhof schwarzbier but this was still my favourite beer that i had there. amazing passionfruit aroma that is alwazs so inviting in kellerbiers but rare to find in a bock. tasted initially of passiona, little sign of the slightly offensive alcohol of some bocks. seems to have been very well lagered. some plum comes through with some orange pip dryness. not much bitterness there but the sweetness is very pleasant, not sweet or syruppy at all, and this is an amazingly drinkable bock
